revised_title: Systematic Study of Photo-Electric Discharge from Metallic Surfaces in Different Gases
tldr: This paper investigates the effect of gas pressure and the nature of the gas surrounding a metal surface on the magnitude of the photo-electric current. The author uses a spark between iron terminals in hydrogen as a constant source of ultraviolet light and measures the photo-electric currents from a zinc surface. The results show that the currents increase with decreasing pressure and can be explained using the ionic theory of conduction.
